Patch Set 24: Code-Review+1
Needs a better commit message.
Done

I don't think you're currently in the Meta CLA, which we will need to get added.  I've put instructions on the internal documentaion.

You'll need to update your name here to match what ends up in the CLA (which looks like it will be "Sharanabasappa K").
Updated as per your suggestion.

Hi Patrick/Amithash,

I am working on porting ncsi-util commands from YV3 to ncsi-netlink tool. As part of that I have made changes to port show-statistics command.
Wanted to get your feedback on the approach. 

This is still work in progress and I have marked by review as private.

I have included the test results(which are hex as of now). I am working to display textual representation.

Please review and let me know if this approach looks good.

Thanks 

Sharan

Great to get the ball rolling.  
Thanks for being the guinea pig.
This will be a great template for all similar tasks.

We'll need to get you added to the Meta CLA.

There are tools in the CI that will check against clang-format, which your submission didn't use (and thus your submission will fail).  You could proactively run the linter / formatter tools.
sure Patrick I have sent the request at https://www.internalfb.com/amp/ACL/CATEGORY_GROUP%3Aopenbmc-lf-cla
Remove the extra ">"
Done
Do we need a "short" for every one?  This one doesn't seem particularly intuitive so I'd probably leave it out if we can.
Sure Patrick. Will change this. Currently checking the code.
Debugging left in?
The debug statements have been eliminated.
Remove misc debugging statements throughout.
The debug statements have been eliminated.
remove the commented out code
Done

What does the result of this look like?  Probably put it in a "Tested" section in the commit message.

I'm a bit surprised to see that we have no parsing here at all.  Is this just going to come out as a blob of bytes?  Can we add some structure to it?
Please mark comments as "resolved" if you've addressed them.
correct the indentation
what is 0x18 for?
Done
Done
Use the correct description. This is for retrieving the statistics right?
Done

What is the provenance of this commit?
An early submission message references YV3.
What's YV3?
Is the source code being pulled licensed to permit the release?
This commit is to port the ncsi-util show statistics functionality to ncsi-netlink.

I know what the commit adds.
I'm asking where this code was copied from.
Is OpenBMC, by including this change, violating someones copyright?
The code is taken reference from: https://github.com/facebook/openbmc/blob/f5510f3d1be8d5035f319a4bbb212e67cf7291e8/common/recipes-lib/ncsi/files/ncsi.h#L253

This was an absolutely terrible thing to point to without further comment...  That code you used as a reference was GPL and this project is Apache.

Meta owns the copyright on the facebook/openbmc repository and is contributing _this_ code under an Apache license.  The referenced code in facebook/openbmc was written without influence from other GPL code and should be ok to pick up as Apache.

This text exceeds the commit message maximum length.
Commit messages are expected to have
50 chars for the message header
and 72 chars for all other lines.

The <7> ..... message exceeds 72 chars by a very wide margin.
Done
nit: suggest putting the `Tested` block in triple backticks for content you literally got as output from the tool when you ran it.
Done
Lets use decimal for things that make sense to be decimal (ie. counts).  This should be fixed throughout.
Done

All of these numbers look suspect.
After an AC cycle on my system, and left to idle for a few minutes I get, with patch 4 to output decimal values:
Total Bytes Received: 0
Total Bytes Transmitted: 3135326126080
Total Unicast Packet Received: 23875723198464
Total Multicast Packet Received: 4294967296
Total Broadcast Packet Received: 0
Total Unicast Packet Transmitted: 25769803776
Total Multicast Packet Transmitted: 0
Total Broadcast Packet Transmitted: 188978561024

There's really no way these values can be accurate in the space of 4 to 5 minutes on a basically idle interface.
Made the changes to correct this.

Hi Patrick,

Thanks for reviewing the code. I have incorporated the comments. I will remove the short option.

Best Regards,
sharanu.k
Here are some observations regarding the current state of the commit.
Not needed?

+1
This is not needed
Done
remove extraneous blank lines
Done
Done

Is this temporary?
This appears to be co-opting the SendOEM command packet handler.
Done
remove blank line
Done

Use new CallBack function to display status instead of sendCallBack. sendCallBack is used by sendOemCallback. The changes you are making in sendCallBack will result in the sendOemCallback command too.
Done
I agree with Patrick, these should all be displayed in decimal.
Done

inconsistent formatting.
This line uses ":"
most others use ": "
favor the latter.
Done

Please follow definition format from linux/ncsi.h
NCSI_CMD_GET_CONTROLLER_PACKET_STATISTICS
Done

This is C++, right? `struct NCSI_Controller_Packet_Stats_Response` rather than `typedef struct`.

(Maintainers might have a preference on a different struct name.)

Isn't snake case frowned upon?
Camel case is found in all other struct definitions
Done
This data structure appears to be missing the response code and the reason code. With these entries in place the packet trans/recv numbers look more sensible than the code as submitted.
Done
Is there a pointer to a spec we should add here?  DSPxxxx , section yy.zz?
DSP0222 NCSI Spec 8.4.50
Done
nit: you're still going to have minor formatting issues like this stray whitespace.  Doesn't seem like you're running clang-format.
Done

Hi Patrick/Jonathan,

Thanks for reviewing the code. I have incorporated all the review comments. Please review the updated patchset and let me know your feedback.

Thanks
Best Regards
Sharan

This commit is too poorly formatted to take the time to review.
Run clang-format on all the CPP/HPP files and re-submit.
Once you have re-submitted the code, confirm that the code builds, and the "Verified" entry in the "Submit Requirements" is a +1.
I'll review again once the code passes CI and is "Verfied +1".
Done

This section indicates that clang-format has not been used prior to committing this change.
The brace placement is incorrect for the namespace lines.
The indentation is too narrow.

Please run clang-format on all files that have been changed and resubmit.
Due to the large number of changes I'm deferring any further review.
Done

It would be nice if you performed some additional reporting.
I used back to back calls, when I fixed the data structure, to confirm the packet count values appeared to be sensible.
It's hard to tell from your example output that the xmit/rcv byte counts are reported accurately.
Is there some way you can confirm the numbers reported?
Done

Hi Patrick/Jonathan,

Thanks for reviewing the code. I have incorporated all the review comments. Please review the updated patchset and let me know your feedback.

Thanks
Best Regards
Sharan
Here are some recommendations

Why are these files being included?
Compilation is successful without these present.
Done

If this is to block compilation errors:
Prefer [[maybe_unused]] void* arg in the function prototype.

This is C++, so prefer nullptr to the C style code here:
arg = nullptr;
Don't do this in this function. Use the maybe_unused method.

1) After using [[maybe_unused]] we are facing ncsi-netlink prints show stats response and control stucks there.It is not exiting.We are looking into it.

2) With this also arg = nullptr getting the same behaviour.

Create and call a ConvertStatsToHostEndianess() fcn,
then call printNCSIControllerStats()
Done

I'd prefer to see the resp and reason codes added to the NCSIControllerPacketStatsResponse structure.
This allows:
NCSIControllerPacketStatsResponse* foo = static_cast<NCSIController....*>(rcv_buf).
instead of manual byte shifting/combining.
In addition, the print controller stats function performs this work.
Why is it separate?

Per Patricks suggestion, make this a be64toh and ntohl modification function.
Done

Send a const ptr to buff that includes the resp code/reason.
Don't manually index.
Done
Done

Suggest to change this whole section to:
std::cout << "\nNIC statistics"
       "\nCounters cleared ... (MSB): " << var1
       "\nCounters cleared ... (LSB): " << var2
       .....
       "Error Jabber Packets Received: " << lastVar "\n";

That way there's only a single cout.
See the usage() model in argument.cpp
Done

Can't we do this when we read the structure in instead of when we're printing it out?  If someone later on adds additional code that uses the structure in original format we're going to end up with these random be64toh sprinkled around.
Doesn't this advice also apply to all of the ntohl() too?
Yes.  This whole function needs to be cleaned up in that regard, not just the one property.
Done
Perhaps submit a kernel commit that adds this to ncsi.h?
Will do. Just wanted to check which repo does this change go to if I add to ncsi.h?

Hi Patrick/Jonathan,

Thanks for reviewing the code. I have incorporated all the review comments. Please review the updated patchset and let me know your feedback.

Thanks
Best Regards
Sharan

Hi Patrick/Jonathan,

Thanks for reviewing the code. I have incorporated all the review comments. Please review the updated patchset and let me know your feedback.

Thanks
Best Regards
Sharan
Recommendations.

If you add the NCISPacketHeader to NCSIControllerPacketStatsResponse, then this could be changed to:
convertStatsToHostEndianess(reinterpret_cast<NCSIControllerPacketStatsResponse*>nsl_data(tb[NCSI_ATTR_DATA]));
and there's no need to create a temporary variable or perform error prone pointer arithmetic.

Shouldn't convertStats...() only convert the statistics data?
It seems that the printStats...() function should be called immediately after the convertStats...() function. See my comments below
Done
Done
Don't do this here.
Done
Done

This function, and the next are effectively private?
Shouldn't the prototype be inside ncsi_util.cpp?
Apply 'static' keyword?
Done

Hi Jonathan,

Thanks for reviewing the code. I have incorporated all the review comments. Please review the updated patchset and let me know your feedback.

Thanks
Best Regards
Sharan
Please change it to --stats or --statistics
Please change it to "stats" or "statistics"
Bring back the NCSIPacketHeader definition here.
Please move this #include to ncsi_util.cpp as it is private to ncsi_utill.cpp
Please move this #define to ncsi_util.cpp

Please move this internal structures to ncsi_util.cpp.
There are few other commits also uses the same NCSIPacketHeader structure. Moving these definitions to ncsi_util.cpp will helps on resolving conflicts and redundant definitions in features
